text.wiki:
Old Town Bridge (Norwegian: Gamle Bybro or Bybroa) is located in Trondheim, Trøndelag County, Norway.


== History ==
Gamle Bybro crosses the  Nidelva River from the south end of the  main street Kjøpmannsgata connecting to the Trondheim neighborhood of Bakklandet. Gamle Bybro was constructed by Johan Caspar von Cicignon  in 1681 in conjunction with the reconstruction of Trondheim after the great fire of 1681. Johan Caspar von Cicignon laid out plans for the reconstruction of Trondheim as well as its fortification. Kristiansten Fortress was built at this time after his plans. The bridge location was of military-strategic significance.  King Christian V of Denmark assumed the cost of construction. It was completed in 1685. The bridge was built in the vicinity of the original Elgeseter Bridge. When it was opened the older bridge was allowed to decay and collapse. Since then  Gamle Bybro has undergone many changes.

Originally  Gamle Bybro  was constructed of wood, but the wood was supported on three stone piers. In the middle of the bridge, an iron  gate was placed. This remained a guarded city gate until 1816. At each end of the bridge there was a toll and guardhouse. The access house on the west end still stands, but that on the east side was taken down in 1824. Gamle Bybro was reconstructed in 1861 by the engineer Carl Adolf Dahl (1828-1907). Today Gamle Bybro is one of Trondheim's characteristic landmarks.
Gamle Bybro is also known as Lykkens portal (Gate of Happiness), after the lyrics of the popular waltz  Nidelven stille og vakker du er ( "Nidelven quiet and beautiful you are")  by Norwegian singer and composer  Kristian Oskar Hoddø (1916-1943).  According to tradition,  Hoddø wrote the waltz about  the Nidelva River one night in late April 1940 while he was  standing at Gamle Bybro. Oskar Hoddø was a member of the resistance movement against the Occupation of Norway by Nazi Germany. He was executed in Trondheim on 17 November 1943 along with eight other Norwegian resistance fighters.

text.quote: Historic bridge featuring red portals & scenic views of the river & quaint, colorful houses.
trip: Bridge is not closed but it was covered in scaffolding making it difficult to see the gears. However the area is definitely still worth a visit

This bridge is the symbol of Trondheim. The harbour area you can see from the bridge itself is fantastic. Great atmosphere. The brigde is beautiful and you can easily understand why it has become so dear to the people of Trondheim

Lovely photo opportunities from this bridge The difficulty with the photos in June 2020 are that paintwork is getting done. However, the decorator - seems to want to appear on everybody’s photo posing with a can of Monster energy drink for the 30 minutes I was there. Cross the

We have been to Trondheim many times and always fit in a walk over this bridge. The bridge is a thoughtfully maintained one to reflect Trondheim and Norway's old maritime history, and in the modern sense promotes walking in this wonderful city.
Include this a part of a stroll around the old part of town between the warehouses or on way up to the cathedral

Its a nice enough looking bridge and you get some nice views of the riverside buildings but its not really a must see. You'll probably use it to cross from the Cathedral into the alleys and shops across the other side of the river.
Beautiful and peacefull... Very nice small stores, galleries and cozy cafe. Ideal for romantic walk.
Really beautiful in the snow. The houses on stilts are so absorbing to look at with their colourful facades. Trondheim in a picture!
A lovely bridge and very old, it crosses the river and allows wonderful views of the old warehouses in the area
A wonderful awesome place to cruise and highly recommend it to anyone who loves wild remote places that make you feel the landscape.
The best spot to take iconic pictures of Baklandet’s old houses with reflections in the water . Worth the walk even on a cold grey winter morning
You can easy walk around and see this old wonderful place. Lots of coffee bars around the place. Think it was really great
This is an important part of Trondheim history and not to be missed. Easy access to the cathedral and to the old town and it's cafes

Beautiful area of the city. The views of the buildings on the water are worth stopping to see. Not sure about the arches on one side of the bridge but they are worth a picture. Close to Nidaros Cathedral

The bridge is on the short 5 km city walk and gives excellent views of the river and old warehouses. It is an excellent spot for taking photos and said to be a very romantic spot. Just down the road is the bicycle lift that is free but only operates in summer. This was
Charming old city views, friendly people, beautiful architecture. A very nice area to walk around. Great views of this picture perfect city.

We walked from our hotel across the Old Town Bridge into the Old Town. It was a beautiful sunny day which lent itself to stopping every-so-often to take pictures and enjoy the view of the colourful Old Town buildings across the river. We also watched a group of people on kayaks
Nice place to visit. You can get an great view of the city and his nice architecture. Recomend to visit.

This is a charming walk. From the bridge, the views up and down the water and of the bryggen are picture-perfect. At the right times of day, the reflections are magical. Great places for a snack or a meal across the bridge, too. I went back a second time.

The Old Town Bridge will lead you into the old town of Trondheim. The bridge itself is pretty interesting. It also provides a great vantage point for picture taking. When walking through Trondheim be sure to walk over the bridge to the old town.
The best vantage point for photos of the old houses on the water and also the gateway to old Trondheim. Iconic and a must do.
It’s worth crossing the old town bridge if you want to experience the intact historical part of old town along the river. The storage houses are lined up and look beautiful in all kinds of weather.
a landmark of Trondheim! very nice bridge and very nice surroundings! It is worth walking around; the area is so picturesque and quiet
A lovely setting in the Old Town of Trondheim. Pedestrianised, loads of cafes and restaurants. Stand a while and enjoy the views along the river.
Definitely worth a visit to if you’re in Trondheim. It’s a must-see tourist attraction and a good photo opportunity.
I had seen it on tv many many times but to see it live is something amazing! so nice! we took amazing photos there!
Highly recommended a visit to the old bridge here in Trondheim. There is also a funny bicycle lift near the bridge. Guess Norwegian just have too much money...

In Norwegian it is known as Gamle Bybro. This Old Town Bridge was first built on this site in 1681. This was at the same time, Kristiansten Fort was under construction. Originally a sentry and excise house stood at either end of the bridge. The excise house on the west side is
The river has nice old houses on each side of it which are quite colourful. Drop by to get a photo or two.

This historic bridge (Gamle Bybro, in Norwegian) crosses Nidelva River and connects the city centre to the ancient Bakklandet quarter. Come here on sunset to take stunning photos of the river and the Bryggene/Bakklandet old houses. The bridge also leads from the city centre to

This little bridge is nice and all, but its the view from the bridge that makes it a five star stop. Google photos of Trondheim and chances are most of them will be the iconic view of the old wharf houses along the river from this bridge.

Pretty bridge and nice walk either side along the canal. During the day we sat in a cafe and watched a wedding group taking pictures - including with a drone. In the evening we say people playing some games which included people carrying each other over the bridge and teams
A nice little bridge - nothing spectacular but has both nice views of the water and the attractive architecture.
Pretty bridge is a good location for viewing and photographing the old wharfs in this part of town. Classic Photoshop.
This is a beautiful old bridge over Nidelvar, crossing it there is the picturesque view to the old dock houses on both sides
Popular with tourists for photos, this wooden bridge links the old town. Many beautiful riverside multi coloured wooden buildings. Definitely worth a walk to see.

This brightly painted, ornate bridge crosses the river and leads to the very picturesque Bakklandet section of Trondheim! The bridge provides great views Bakklandet buildings and their reflections in the river!
It’s a nice bridge close to the fantastic cathedral so when your there don’t skip it give it a view .

The red Old City Bridge connects Old Town and New Town Trondheim. The Gamle Bybro was originally constructed of wood, but the bridge and gates today are a reconstruction. In the 1600’s, there was a guard at either end of the bridge. The carved gates of the Gamle Bybro Bridge
It's a bridge, no doubt! Not sure what to write about this old town bridge, it's a bridge with some nice gates on it. The best part is the view over the old wood buildings along side Nidelven.
Not sure what to expect from the Old Town bridge. The 2 gates mark the old bridge but the real attraction is the view of the houses along the Nidelva
This is a lovely spot in the city, among many similar lovely spots with similar views. It is worthwhile to stroll over the bridge in order to explore the lovely other side of the river.

Since this is one of the unique landmarks of Trondenheim, you might want to do a quick visit. It was built from 1681-1685 after the great fire, about the same time as the Kristiansten Fortress, and was part of the defense strategy. The original bridge was of wood and supported
The Old Town Bridge is the place where you take the iconic picture of Trondheim's Bakklandet Old Town. Nice view but not much else.
Built in 1861 this bridge gives the connection between the city center and district Bakklandet. Enjoy this old bridge during your walk around.

Our walking tour from a Hurtigruten ferry went over the Old Town Bridge. It is a small pedestrian only bridge and is quite picturesque. The draw bridge area is not very big - only small barge like vessels would have been able to pass through. If you have time, I recommend
Nice view of the colorful buildings on stilts. Pedestrian area. Go and see the bicycle lift on the other side!!

This is the best access to the Old Town Area on your way to or from the Nidaros Cathedral. The views from the bridge (watch out for bikes!) are very nice. There were many cormorants and other seabirds hanging around. One of the better sights to see in Trondheim.
Beautiful view from the bridge and the cobbled Bakklandet street the bridge leads to is also beautiful.
Great view of the old storage buildings located along the Nidelven river. The bridge itself isn't exactly the new Charles Bridge.
Lots of history and nice shopping places here. Take the time to look around and do a little shopping.

After the great fire in Trondheim in 1681, Gamla Bybro was built, completed four years later. As a main access point to the Old Town, it gets busy ie inundated with tourists by late morning. You will have it to yourself in an early morning visit. The views from the bridge are

This is a really nice part of the city. Some of the buildings are renovated, but they seems to have kept the authentic expression of the buildings, and by that kept the atmosphere. It's a lovely walk in a lovely city! :-)
Beautiful sights from the old bridge. We had great luck that the weather was awesome. Would go there again.
This is known as Camle Bybri in Norwegian and the bridge to Baaklandet where the Old Town is. It is only a pedestrian bridge and not for cars

Had a short day in Trondheim so tried to catch all the highlights. This was our last following the cathedral and palace so we were a bit tired. It was worthwhile and not hard to find but not spectacular. Just a beautiful bridge crossing a calm water surrounded by old buildings.
Beautiful place with views to the river, ancient buildings,lots of cafes and restaurants nearby, including my lovely Peppez Pizza :).

This was one of those less than impressive surprises. The photos made it look amazing but in person it was more like a movie set and unreal. The views of the river from the bridge were nice and it led us into the Bakklandet neighbor.

If you cross it and don't plummet into the river below, it is bridging like a bridge ought to bridge. The way this bridge connects two land masses separated by a geographical obstacle is absolutely equivalent to the majority of bridges in the world. In this way it has
Great area of the city. Beautiful wooden buildings along the waterfront. Easy to walk around. Well worth a visit.
Wonderful and charming place to visit if you go to Trondheim. A lot of small places to go and drink a cup of coffee.
Very close to the Cathedral. Cross the river to see all the old warehouses, shops, restaurants, etc. Popular.

If one is in Trondheim, then one must walk over the Old Town Bridge. Looking down river view from the bridge is about as picturesque as it gets. Plus, it is the best way to get the Old Town and the fortress.

Perhaps we stopped by on an unusually good day but glorious weather and the relaxed chatter of locals and tourists created a really great atmosphere and showed the best of Trondheim, in my opinion. The bridge itself is worth the stop with a distinctive and appealing look and

This is a beautiful old bridge, in great condition, which is worth visiting and photographing. The wood structure of the bridge itself is very pleasant and interesting. From the bridge, you see lovely buildings on each side, perfect photography spot. I was staying in Bakklandet

Very nice bridge that gives you a view over the Nid river and colorful houses along the river which are perfect for photo ops. Crossing the bridge takes you to Bakklandet which is a very very nice area with sweet old houses and shops and restaurants.
The bridge itself is not much, but the view from it is the best of Trondheim. Specially conbined with nice lighting conditions!
Definitely an Insta spot with magnificent Norwegian homes in the distance. Stop and capture a moment on the bridge!
Very nice bridge in center, great place to sit on the sun or just stroll or enough the view, a nice bar just below which gives a nice view to it.
I walked from the cruise port to the Old Town and the bridge. Very scenic on a freezing winter day but well worth the view.

Beautiful bridge in the heart of Trondheim.Wonderful historic bridge with side lifting section with original pulleys and chains. Pretty old bridge one minute walk from the cathedral. Pedestrian only. In the vicinity of the main town centre.Nice view point of the river and

Fine wooden bridge over the river - lots of great views over to the Nidaros Cathedral and up to the Kristiansten Fortress - if you can see it through the snow. The building on the river bank are very colourful and worth a look.
Beautiful spot for pictures. The structure is interesting and it deserves a walk there - also to visit the neighborhood.
A real highlight was seeing the bridge and river. I really enjoyed seeing the colorful buildings up against the river. The bridge also leads to the Bike lift, fort and old town.
Trondheim's most famous bridge. You can take nice photographs of the iconic colourful building on the canal from the bridge.
Near the iconic colourful buildings on the canal, it's a nice little detail of the history of the city.
It is a great photo opportunity. The houses and businesses on either side of the river are beautiful.

Old Town Bridge is beautiful, especially in the winter. While walking around Trondheim you'll pass the Old Town Bridge on your way to other main sites. There are some nice views from the bridge, but otherwise you won't need to spend a whole lot of time at the site.
I passed this bridge on the way back from the Nidaros Cathedral. It was covered in snow and very pretty. Lovely spot for great photos.

Worth visiting especially if you have been to the cathedral as it's really close. Not much you can say about it but it is a different landmark. Rumour has it if you kiss someone under it you will stay together forever!! Make of that, what you will.
This Old Town Bridge is a really beautiful place to walk on a sunny day with a great view of the old wooden houses. The snow clad bridge has its own beauty in winter too

The Old Town Bridge connects the CBD area of Trondheim to the “historical heart” of the town. It is an ideal photographic spot to “take shots” of the colourful wooden warehouses that line either side of the slow flowing river.
what remains of the bridge is well preserved and worth a look. From the bridge you can see some of the original warehouses very well preseved

We had been to the cathedral and the bridge isn’t far from there and is the access point to the old town. We were told that if we tell our loves that we love them on the bridge, it will last for eternity. The views from the bridge up and down the river was just wonderful
The Old Town Bridge is one more stop you will want to make on your walking tour of this beautiful city.
I was walking through the streets and arrive until the Old bridge and the bridge and the views from there are really beautiful!!!

This is the famous port of Trondheim. The river view is amazing and the old buildings along Nidelven is mirroring themselves in the river. Well known photgraped symbol of the city. It’s a must see object in Trondheim.
Nice view of historic old houses along the canal! Also nice area to stroll along explore the old houses and cafes.

The Old Town Bridge is quite a feature of the town. Adds a very nice touch to the lovely walks that abound in the city. We passed the bridge on the way to the old fortress over the river. Lovely area to visit.
Liked the scenery but bad weather limited nice photo shots. Good stroll through the quiet town with great companions will enhance your experience of the town.

It is said that if you kiss your sweetheart between the arches on the old town brigde it brings fortune to the relationship. If, on the other hand, your sweetheart doesnt love you back the locals will run in and rugby tackle you and throw you off.
Old part of the city is nice to walk around, and sit down for a coffee, and is also a short trip to the Kristiansten Fortress with a nice view over the city.

This is such a charming and beautiful ancient wooden bridge, located quite centrally in Trondheim. One end of the bridge has two ancient, beautifully carved portals that stand together and are called "Lykkens portal" (the portal of happiness). Both the railing on the bridge
We saw the sunrise come up over the river and were treated to brilliant views north and south along the river. Great photo opportunity
Cute old bridge that serves its purpose of getting pedestrians from one side of the river to the other. Go from St. Olav’s to the Old Town and take a photograph.
Looks more like the entrance to 'chinatown' than an ancient bridge (Having seen the one in Prague). Nice views of the wooden warehouses from the centre of the bridge.
Fantastic bit of architecture - well worth strolling by as part of a visit to the old town. Take in the bike lift too - amazing bit of eco-tech!
Especially nice to see from a canoe in the river. You can rent them at the edge of the city en row to the harbour. Abvit crowded when you are standing on the bridge and limited view.
I decided to see this bridge on Sunday afternoon and I can say That this construction is in my opiniom the biggest atraction of Trondheim. The view is amazing from there. Strongly reccomended.
A lovely bridge that is worth the walk to. A really nice historical wharf area. Completely different to the new town area.
Beautiful bridge with a good view and nice atmosphere to Nidelva river and the Old riverside houses.
The old Town bridge , Gamle Bybro, is the entrance to Bakklandet, the old Town and former centrum in Trondheim. A splendid place to view and make photos!
By stopping for a photo (local legend has it) you will have good luck! And it is an excellent place to do just that.

If you are going to look around the Bakklandet neighborhood, then you should walk over the bridge! Eat dinner at nearby Bakklandet Skydstation, and drink beers dockside (weather permitting) right below the bridge at Den Gode Nabo ("The Good Neighbor" Pub).
Pretty old bridge leading to the old town side of the river. Nice place to look down the river and enjoy the views
The old city bridge and gate are a must-see in Trondheim. Together with the cathedral and the fort it gives a nice picture of how kings used to be hundreds of years ago.

If you have visited the great Cathedral, you are just a few minutes walk from "Gammel Byron" or the Old Town Bridge. It spans the Nidelva River and is a beautiful old houses and wharf buildings that make this part of Trondheim so special. You can even see the bicycle lift
Nowadays is pedestrian only. Great for a leisurly walk across and get a feel for the Trondheim of old. Also great photo ops on either side, particularly on a sunny day
Beautiful walk along the river. I recommend this area for everyone who comes to visit the city and the area.
Beautifull bridge with postcard-views of the houses by the river, specially if the weather is nice, like we had.

Nice little bridge at the centre of most of the tourist attractions in Trondheim City Centre. Picture square location. Beware of all the bicycles that rushing their way around, you are expected to give way to them
The view from the bridge along the river is easily one of my favourite in the whole of Europe, Norwegian Venice, but so much calmer and without the bad smell. I was literally in awe when I saw it.
Nice spot to take some photos of the well known houses/buildings along the River Nidelva. Near the Nidaros cathedral. Often quite busy, so may be hard to get good photos, but it’s worth a stop.
The bridge looks like a mix of Chinese architecture with Victorian industrialization. The views from the bridge are awesome. Trondheim at its best.

A lovely pedestrian bridge provides excellent views. It is at the foot of the incredibly steep hill that leads to Kristiansten fortress. Be sure to check out the unique bicycle lift at the foot of the hill and see it in action if you are lucky

This pedestrian bridge is very popular. Walk through refurbished Old Town to the bridge or from the other direction from the 13th Century Cathedral. The view both to the left or right from the bridge provides a fabulous view of the restored riverside Warehouses. Word is to

Not too much here but sure a lot of history and very scenic self and surroundings. Certainly a must-see when in very nice Trondheim...but beware, I'm biased, as I've found that the founder of Trondheim was my 6th Cousin, King Olav Tryggvason! Ancestry is highly recommended.

This is a really lovely pedestrian bridge, you'll want to check it out when you're exploring the Old Town. The views along the river are very nice. Although you can't drive across in a car, you are allowed to bike across it, so you could make this part of your bike tour if you

If you cross over and walk to the left theres a small art gallery. Highly recommend visiting as the owner is lovely and paints everything herself. Bought a stunning little piece for myself and look forwad to displaying. Theres lots of traditional norwegian homes down this walk

If you are in Trondheim this is one of the essential things to see. The bridge is called the Portal of Happiness. It is an example of 17th Norwegian construction and quite charming. There really isn't much more to say about it. It's a free attraction so you might as well

This bridge itself is only moderately impressive. It seems to have once had a defensive role, but no longer. But the bridge connects to fascinating parts of the old city and has beautiful views of the placid river, its flanking buildings, and the hills beyond. Definitely
Good place.. it shows the norwegian and vikings times..very lovely, better to visit during not rainy day season

Every brochure and tour tells you to go see this bridge. It is a pretty bridge, but I would not walk there just to see this bridge. It is the gateway to another attraction, the wooden houses, which in my opinion is a more impressive attraction. Hard to miss if you visit the
It can be a bit overcrowded during a touristy season but it's a nice place to take pictures at. No cars are allowed on to the bridge so feel free to walk where ever you want.

Must see and make sure to kiss your loved one on it for eternal love!! Make sure to rent bikes in this town. The trondheim public bikes are awesome, but not the greatest on the hard hills b/c the bikes are very heavy. On most of the city they work great, just don't try to go

This old bridge is ideal way to see the old the colorful 'saved' warehouses along the fjord end in Trondheim. Across the bridge is a bicycle ' lift ' which transports bicycle & passenger up a steep hill. University students often help the riders to mount the lift. The bridge was
The bridge marks the entrance to Bakklandet - the old town of Trondheim. Come early in the morning before the crows and enjoy the pretty views to both sides of the canal.
Stroll down from the Nidaros cathedral towards the old town, which you approach after crossing this lovely old bridge. Photo opportunities of the old buildings on the waterside.
We stubbles across this just while walking around town. Nice bridge and gear view if the converted storage warehouses along both sides of the camel.
Very nice bridge to take photos of Trondheim from. When looking at the details it is amasing that the bridge is from 1685.

After seeing the cathedral we headed for the bridge as we were going to have lunch just across the river. The bridge is pedestrian and is a lovely place to take pictures under the picturesque wooden arches and also is a good place to stand to view the old wooden building that
We stumbled across this bridge while walking -- From it you can see a lot of the older buildings along the river (I think it's a river). A lot of people seem to hang out here.

The bridge is most interesting and different and as a pedestrian only bridge you get to walk all over. Great views of the old wooden buildings lining the river and a must for the visitor. It is even free!
We saw the bridge crossing it into the cosy «Bakklandet» district, and gliding under it on a kajakk trip.
You haven't been in Trondheim if you haven't strolled over this bridge. Today it is only for pedestrians, which is a benefit. It is the landmark of Trondheim.

This lovely bridge is available and free 24 hours a day - and with the sun up all night, you can get great photos any time you choose. Walk across the bridge and then stroll the streets of the Bakklandet (old town section) and along the wharves. So picturesque!
On our way back we jump in to the interesting Old Town Bridge over the Nidelva. You have a nice view over the houses at the river bank from the bridge.

You have to walk to this bridge if you are in Trondheim. From there, you can also take nice photos of the Bakklandet old town. If you keep going through the old town and up the hill, you get to the fortress. Be aware of cyclists and runners on the bridge!
Pleasant pedestrian bridge with great views that offer a feeling of history as you look on both sides of the water...and the cathedral spires in the background.
We went across this bridge to get up to the Kristiansten Fortress. It was quaint and kept up nicely.
Walked over it a couple of times on my way up to fort. I have seen nicer old bridges.. one springs mind in Lucerne. But worth a visit.
My fascination with bridges is endless. I should have been a civil engineer. This quaint bridge is simple but beautiful and is the gateway to the old town part of Trondheim.
It is always a pleasure to get to the Old Town Bridge coming from the right side of the Nidelva river: calm and peaceful roads, with bikes and a slow pace. Hot spot for pictures
It is a previlge if you are able to walk around in the beautiful old town with typical Nordic style of houses. They are so nicely colored and taken care of that you feel like in the old times.

Once a main route over the river it is now a pedestrian amble. Take another route if you are in a hurry. The was a lifting section. The machinery is still in place but it is no loger clear if the section lifted or it was 2 draw bridges that met. It's just a wooden bridge.

While you know this bridge has great historic meaning and you appreciate the fact that it is restricted to pedestrians and cyclists, in reality it does not really inspire much emotionally. You sense that somewhere under the tarmac there is a wooden bridge, but really all you can
The bridge is lovely and quaint. Ideally situated on a circuit through the old town and tourist attractions, it is a nice stop along the river for photos.
Visit this cute little bridge. Nice place to take pictures of the old warehouses along the river, the river itself, as well as the university main building.
A must seeing place, close to city Centre, Easy to visit, can go by walk. next to Cathedral so two places can bee seen in one visit.
The reason to walk over this bridge is to make a nice circuit with Solsiden and Baklandet and some very scenic buildings along the water. Close to the Nidarosdomen as well.

This bridge built in 1681 connects two parts of town and previously had an iron gate with a guard and a tollhouse until 1816. Now it is just a pretty wooden bridge with a park under it and nice views on either side. It is nice for a peaceful stroll and an easy walk from the

The legend says that if you kiss on the bridge, then you will be together forever. We have for 35 years, but it is worth taking out an insurance policy just in case. The view up and down the Nid is worth it anyway, especially on a sunny day!
super pretty and not to be missed - I walked over it at night and in the morning and you get a great view!
There was snow on the bridge which made it look spectacular! Snow on either sides with water flowing in the river made it a memorable sight :)

A great little piece of history that provides outstanding view of the old waterfront, the fort and the river. When the sun gets low in the sky (not too low as the buildings will be in shadows) is the time for photos. The colours on the bridge and the waterfront buildings are
This is just along from the amazing cathedral and signal entry to old Trondheim, a very attractive area.

Visited in March 2018 when it was pouring rain so didn’t really see it at it’s best but, what we did see was a lovely, quaint bridge over a river with really beautiful views. We just saw it as we were walking to visit the cathedral and I would say it is definately worth a visit
This is a great starting point to a picturesque town it connects the new and old and a good viewing place well worth a visit especially in the snow
Took a stroll down to the cathedral and found the Old Town bridge which was really picturesque especially in the snow.
This bridge connects the old and new town and is a lovely place to view the buildings along the river. From this point all the sights are an easy walk away
My hiking tour through Trondheim has started and before you enter the old city of Trondheim, you have to cross over its bridge. You can't miss it.

what l like about this bridge is that it takes you to the old part of town years ago the area was inhabited by the poorer people now it has become a desirable area to live and of so now the house prices have gone up, my family used to live there so when l visit l enjoy seeing

We were told that if we kissed under the arches happiness would be ours ... so of course we did and I'm sure it will come true! A lovely spot in its own right without the fable and the Folk and Fe restaurant over the bridge well worth a visit for great food and service.

If you visit Trondheim during winter time, you'll find this place and the surrounding area very beautiful, when covered by snow. I had a small walk from my hotel, going to the church, was nice to see it.
Not to be missed especially during the Dusk Hours when the water affords a perfect reflection of the colored cottages lining both sides. Its quite romantic too. A Must Visit!

So... I am born and raised in Trondheim. I have passed this bridge by foot, bike, motorcycle and car thousands of times. I don't find it interesting at all. And i can not understand that anyone will think it is special.. It is a lovely old bridge though. And i am glad that the
I must admit: I fell in love with Trondheim! Such a lovely and vibrant city with sooo many places to hang around. Old Town Bridge is one of the marvelous sightseeing points to enjoy Trondheim view.
I was exploring Trondheim, when I passed the old town bridge . It looked very scenic in the snow . The town is a very nice place to walk amongst the wood shops and houses . Well worth a stroll .
Perfect spot at Bakklandet, the coziest place in Trondheim. In the city centre of Trondheim. perfect views :)

Go there and take a picture from the bridge down the river as every tourist does! Your smartphone picture will have much more sentimental value than all those thousands professionally taken photos from the same location. You will not regret.
Nice to walk through and take a photo. You can then walk into old town which is quite small and stop for a coffee.
Nice to walk through , quite short. Lovely to walk into old town over this bridge. Old town is beautiful to stroll through and have coffee
A must stop visiting Trondheim together with Bakklandet neighbourhood. Best spot to take picture of the houses on stilts and also Nidarsos chathedral with the river in the front.
Old town bridge is a stopover everyone does when in Trondheim. Short walking bridge the connects the cathedral to the old part of town. Good for pictures and Instagram.

If you’re in Trondheim, the Old Town Bridge (Gamle Brybo) is definitely worth seeing. It’s close to Nidaros Cathedral and allows for easy access to the old town. The bridge itself is quaint and photogenic, and it also affords great views of the river Nid and the waterside
Recommend following the scenic walking tour around to Trondheim. It will take you through the old town, over this bridge and past the cathedral. Great views over the river.
Worth a visit and a cross over , one side the impressive cathedral the other a nice street fool of traditional houses and very well take care little coffee and shops. Definitely much go if Trondheim.
It is perfect to walk Bakklandet and over the Old Town Bridge. It is beautifully ornamented and the wives up and down the river are great. Best place to take pictures in town :)
Excellent photo opportunity from this quaint bridge. Just a short walk from the cathedral. Cross it into the old town.
Go and see old city. Have a croissant and black coffee near river bank. Enjoy the nature and have fun.
The bridge itself is pretty though not spectacular. However we found it was a great vantage point for taking photos down the river of the colourful buildings.
It's a bridge with an OK view of the University and some of the historical Brygge-buildings. And as a bridge it is also quite useful for crossing the river..
No pictures of Trondheim without the gates across the bridge. A nice sight right in the center of town.
The old town bridge ( or Gamble Bybro) is the place to go in Trondheim to see the spectacular view of the surrounding colored old woodfronts.
One of the most beloved and visited tourist motives in Trondheim. Part of the old Trondheim, along the river Nidelv, very suitable for quiet walks, and Close to the City Centre of Trondheim.

Looking for that iconic photo location in Trondheim? Look no further then the old town bridge. It offers great views of the river, and of the old warehouses along it with their bright colors. It's also the gateway into old town Trondheim, with cobblestone streets and great

Walking across this pretty little bridge gives opportunity to take in the good views of buildings on both sides of the Nidelva and the river itself. The bridge is easy to find and links the centre with the old district of Bakklandet.
Offers great views of the River and the old part of the city. Absolutely stunning when covered in snow.
This is well worth a look - it is pretty and you can get some good views of the older waterside buildings as well as the fortress.

We recently visited the Old Town Bridge in Trondheim in late December 2017. The bridge is a beautiful site and we walked across to visit the Old City. Due to the hour we were there (8:30 am) nothing was open once on the other side of the bridge (save a 7/11). We were able to

Everyone that comes to Trondheim must visit Bakklandet and the old bridge. Always stop for a photo.. it's like something from a post card! Perfect place to be on a sunny day, close to bars and restaurants that serve amazing food.

The walk throug the bridge is short. It is an old wooden bridge with no car, only for walking. The bridge have a low fence against the river so you get a nice view of the river and can see the range of the old brews. The bridge have two red wodden portales with carvings that

We stayed in a great airbnb in the old town( Bakklandet) and it's well worth crossing the bridge to wander around the old town with it's pretty houses, restaurants & cafés. We watched the fireworks on New Years Eve whilst standing on the Old Town Bridge. Also lovely view of

The bridge was constructed by Johan Caspar von Cicignon in 1681 after the great fire of Trondheim. Originally it was constructed out of wood, and was supported on three stone piers. There was an iron gate in the middle of the bridge. At each end of the bridge there was a toll
Great location to see the wooden warehouse's of Trondheim. From their you can walk into the city centre or climb to the fortress

The view from the bridge is lovely. It spans the Nidelva River and the beautiful houses of Baklandet are on show. It’s an excellent place to take a picture and there are some very nice cafes in Baklandet where you can grab a cup of coffee and just take in the friendly atmosphere.

We stopped here on our walk to the cathedral (less than 4 minutes away) and it was a lovely, inspiring and enjoyable introduction to Trondheim, and introduction to the incredible cathedral. The architecture of the bridge and surrounding buildings, the sun rising iver the snow
From this bridge you can get some stunning photos of Trondheim and its location next to the bike lift means it is near other tourists spots.

This is probably the most famous spot view of the old city. Colored houses climb the river on both sides. Nice colors during the day, romantic lights at night. Absolutely to visit and walking around you’ll find nice restaurants and bars.

The bridge connects the old and new town. Its the city’s iconic site. Its a must visit for the first time tourist. This is also where you can find the old city’s colorful houses which is another must see. Nice profile pic in FB
Idylic atmosphere on and around this old bridge. Love the architecture! Close ti the city and the Nidaros cathedral. Cozy coffee shops in the area. Worth a visit!

If you are walking from the cathedral to the old town area and then up to the fort on the hill this bridge is a great way to go. On the bridge you get a good view of the attractive waterfront area. There are a number of nice coffee shops just off this bridge. As a bonus check
It is what it is an old bridge but very photogenic and you get a good view of the warehouses along the river from there.
I have walked over the bridge sometimes, and the view from the bridge is nice on a sunny day in Trondheim. If you go to the doctor old part of Trondheim it’s nice to walk over this bridge.
If your visit Trondheim, use this Bridge not only for getting on the other side of the River. It is the one if the most popular places to take some postcard pictures :)
Attractive bridge joining old and new parts of town crossing the Nidelva River. Lots of shops are located in the area on the other side of the river.
As bridges go, it wasn't so bad, but there is only so much you can do. Lean on the railings, peer over the railings, look both ways along the bridge. Not sure why i'm even reviewing it

I used to cross this bridge to and from work for a few years. It is one of the most photographed spots in Trondheim. The tales say that if you cross this bridge, you will be happy the rest of your life. I can not guerantee this, but it is quite beautiful and so is the river it

Not only is the old bridge beautiful in itself, but its proximation to the two highlights (old town and Nidarosdommen) and its stunning views makes this, in my opinion, THE place to visit when in Trondheim - rain or shine.
This is a lovely area of the city. The bridge is beautiful, and there is a nice view of the historic wharves.
Just happened to be walking in the rain and found this quite by accident, lovely architecture. Gives a great view of the Bryggen

All within the downtown of Trondheim , are some interesting places to see including the "happyness bridge "This structure allows visitors and residents alike to cross the small water course or canal to see the businesses located along the banks . From the bridge you can see some

One of Trondheim's more well-known landmarks, the Old Town Bridge (or Gamle Bybro in Norwegian) has its origins in the 17th century. Built and rebuilt a number of times, it links both banks of the city across the Nidelva City. It's fairly modest in size, and is marked at the

There is a Norwegian song about this bridge. My 90 year old Mother was born and raised in Trondheim and moved to the US in the 60's. It was so much fun to bring her back to this bridge so she could sing her favorite song.
the view over the old houses was nice. the bridge itself does not have any attraction by itself, but the view is nice
Well, it is a nice old bridge with a scenic view, not so much more to say about it. Worth a couple of pictures if you are walking around Trondheim

You can walk on this bridge, just grab a warm beverage from the shops around and enjoy the scenary. All old colourful houses, with wooden holders inside water makes it a perfect typical piece of Scandinavia to visit.
Great area to stroll before or after dinner when you've already seen the main sites. Neat homes and businesses in this area.

This is a rather unique bridge that crosses the Nidelva River. If you plan to visit the Nidaros Cathedral, this bridge is within walking distance. The bridge is also known as "The Gate of Happiness" and we heard that it was good luck to kiss on the bridge so... There are a
Amazing architect with beautiful view. Must see place in Trondheim. I stayed in Trondheim for almost 4 years and totally loved this place

Along with the Nidarosdomen cathedral, this is one of the absolute must sees in Trondheim. Enjoy the views of the river and dock houses, and be sure to wander the cobble stone streets of Bakklandet. Also located next to the bridge is the bicycle lift "Trampe". The hill with this
The whole plce is a must to visit, a lot of cozy places to eat ir just drink coffee or tea or other specialities.
This bridge takes you from main town centre into the quaint side of Trondheim - plenty of cafes and photo opportunities
I was told that the name for this picturesque bridge meant happiness. It crosses the Nidelva river in Trondheim. From the bridge you have a great view of the colorful houses along the Nidelva River
Very well restored old bridge and with the sun out it was a good place to visit and watch people. It gives a great view of the old warehouses as well and that makes it a good place to hang out at.
Different and part of the old town experience. It leads you over to the far bank of the river and a walk through a delightful old town buildings in many attractive colours.
Quaint bridge with very beautiful view of the river, with old colorful buildings standing close together, and being reflected on the water.
A nice old historical bridge with good canal views. Not far from the cathedral or the centre of town so worth a detour to take a quick look.

The bridge is nice and you get a great view to the river. Cross the bridge and you will be in the Bakklandet (a must to see). Area with old houses and nice cafees and shops in old style. Close to the attraction Nidarosdomen.
Take a stroll from Bakke bridge, through the nostalgic Bakklandet and over this beautiful landmark bridge. This is a must see when in Trondheim.

The bridge itself is nothing special actually, but the place where it is located, inside the old district of Trondheim, with the canal, all the woodden houses and the park below makes it a very beautiful place where to have a walk and relax
Walking around Trondheim can be a very interesting experience, and when you get to the Old Town Bridge it gets even better, it's a beautiful sight.
I'd recommend taking a stroll across this bridge while exploring Old Town. The bridge itself is interesting, and the view down the river is very nice.
Nice, small and old bridge! you can take a look to the old buildings and houses around the bridge. Worth it to drink a coffee in the old cafes closed by.
It's a really good place where take a characteristic picture of the old "houses" of Trondheim. You can't miss it.
Lots of interesting shops, a relaxing walk. Take a good camera, because the look is very nice. Good both in summer and winter.
Walking from Nidarosdommen, the bridge is a nice stop on your way to Baklandet. Stop for photos of the bridge, the old houses and the view down the river.

The Old Town Bridge is also known as the Bridge of Happiness. The story goes if you kiss your love under the arches of the bridge you will find happiness. From the bridge there are great views of the waterfront warehouses. Be careful when standing on the bridge as there are
Unmissable to see this bridge, when you are visiting Trondheim. Take a stroll to the river and take a picture togheter with the colorful houses at the harbour!
To stand on this bridge looking at the river in the evening when the sun is going down behind you. It can be better. And as a place to take one loved, it can become more romantic.

On a windless day, the reflection of the colorful buildings in the water makes great photography. Don't miss the "bicycle lift" just across the street from the bridge entrance. It is interesting to see the innovative, but expensive way locals and tourists can get their bikes

For a mechanical/structural engineer a nice piece of construction works of the old days that is interesting to have a close look at. The bridge was built in 1860-1861 and is still in a very good condition.

We stayed on the other side of the old town bridge so we crossed the bridge often. We absolutely loved the view. The bridge compliments the colorful houses lining both shores. It is a must see landmark. Try to go early as the tourist crowd can be overwhelming. There is also

If you were to create a short list of the iconic components of Trondheim, the Old Town Bridge needs to be near the top. Once you have seen the historical sites, crossing the river for a different perspective is a requirement. During our four-day visit to the city, we crossed
Beautiful bridge crossing the river, also giving a nice view of the riverside houses out towards the fjord.
Old but beautiful bridge in Trondheim. Take a stoll over the bridge and along the cafes and small shops in Bakklandet area.

Old Town Bridge is a small woden bridge that dates back to 1681/85. It was used for military purposes and was financed by the Norwegian king. The brigde is a perfect spot for photography, and looks over the old part of Trondheim. The old town has characteristic wodden houses
Nice walking tour via bridge to the Kristiansen castle from the city center. Nice view to the river. Nice coffee houses in the other side of the river.
It was really cool to see an older perspective of the city! It's very romantic, and a great spot for photos to boot. Feels like Amsterdam, almost.
The most romantic place in town, it's called 'The happiness gate'. Nice view of the river Nidelva and close to picturesque Bakklandet.
Visited where my grandmother married and lived when young. This bridge is just like it was in old photos. Great views. Not for cars, walking across only.
This is a beautiful spot for your selfies! It's one of the most famous places in the city. It's super idyllic with the wooden houses close to the river. A must-see in Trondheim.

It's nice. If you visit - you will walk it and take a nice picture with your significant other and/or family. There is a great bar on a barge just off one end of the bridge. If it is not raining - be sure to have a beer.
cozy place and beautiful view! very beautiful reflection of the house into the water. its nice to stroll, taking pictures or relax in this area.

At last, a bridge with some character and great views of the colourful old buildings. When you get to the other side of the bridge follow the road uphill (a little steep) to reach the old Christian fortress. Some great views from the top of here....and you might just see some

This is a pretty small walking path bridge with a great view of the architecture. On the day we went there was a bottle xylophone player that was performing. A fun thing to walk through after a meal on mainstreet.

The bridge is the entrance to the old part of town. It is a nice maintained bridge. From the bridge you have a beautiful view on the colourful old harbour warehouses.
We took this way to get to the Cathedral because it was recommended by the hotel. We were impressed by the beauty of both the gate and the backs of the buildings along waterway below the bridge.

Best place to take photos of the old buildings but it can be a little busy here with a lot of people. Before/after the bridge are small cafes you can drop by for a cup of coffee. We might have missed it, but some facts or history of the bridge could be placed somewhere to let us
Visited here and made for a lovely picture dropback. Was taken here by our exchange students family.

Having seen many beautiful bridges throughout Europe, this one is nothing special. I know that there were a ton of tourists enjoying it but I'd recommend going to Lucerne, Switzerland if you want to see a beautiful bridge.
The bridge is interesting for its type of construction and surrounded by the beautiful old buildings that make Trondheim so unique.

This is the old city bridge, one of the famous sites in Trondheim, a place of interest for anyone visiting Trondheim and one of Trondheim's characteristic landmarks. Come to see the beautiful bridge or just hangout and check out the tourists. Close to many other attractions such
you can join this old bridge only be foot or with bicycle. nothing special but the view from this bridge to the river and the old town is beautiful. must see in trondheim.
A good walk around Trondheim will normally include this little charming place. Make sure you don't miss it on your way top or from the Cathedral.

Lovely old bridge with fascinating buildings with their side facing the water supported by some poles that have seen better days. We had some sunshine which made it all the better. The bridge leads to a little very old group of shops.
Loved the city, this part is particularly quaint with lovely views. Nice stroll! Relaxed atmosphere.
A pretty bridge. It's old (very) and speaks of a time when seaports were very different and ships much smaller. It's something to stop past whilst in the area, not a destination in its own right.
A beautiful old bridge. Just minutes from the Cathedral this pedestrian only bridge should be part of any visit to Trondheim. It has beautiful views down the river
Go here on a sunny day and marvel at the view from the bridge towards Bakklandet. Well worth visiting.

Everybody goes to see the Nidaros Cathedral, but you should not miss the Old Town Bridge, not only for its unique attraction in itself, but much more for the pleaded view it gives up and down the river.

A nice bridge to cross from the cathedral to the nice area on the other side of the river. Nice spot for picture and relaxing, plenty of coffee place on the other side of the bridge (not the cathedrale side)
Great views from the bridge to the wooden houses next to the Nidelva river. There are no cars allowed on the bridge, only bike riders and pedestrians.
A friend of mine recommended to walk over this bridge. The weather was beatutiful and the cosy bridge is a pleasant site in the middle of the city. Walk across it and admire Nidelven
The best place to view the old buildings and warehouses.... a busy tourist location and well worth a visit...
This bridge, also known as the Portal of Happiness is a popular place to get some nice pictures of the river and the colorful buildings along the water. Great place to visit on a bright sunny day.
Lots of nice views from the bridge. Great area to walk right between the old town area of Trondheim and the more built up city portion.
Historic bridge that connect you to Bakklandet. Entering this bridge you come to a historic part of Trondheim.
It's hard to get overly enthusiastic about a bridge but this one is lovely. It connects two halves of Trondheim.
Its a place you must to go in Trondheim. The bridge and the view give to the tourist a nice feeling of the old city. The colorful houses and the ships in the fiord are just perfect.
Very picturesque walk along the river and over the bridge. Lots of cafés to stop off for refreshments.
The Old Town Bridge - was first built on this site in 1681 . The Old Town Bridge is also known under the nickname "Lykkens Portal", which means "Portal of Happiness".

This is a nice 20-minute walk from the ferry terminal, we had around 2-hours in port and it was a beautiful sunny morning so we ventured to the old town bridge with its gorgeous view over the colourful old buildings lining the river front. Spring brings a lovely freshness and
I loved the look of this bridge! It was a pretty short walk and took you right to the bike lift which takes you up the steepest hill of the city towards the fortress!

It’s a bridge, over a canal, with a wonderful view. That’s it! Take a picture of the canal with wooden buildings on the banks and over the water. Next take the same picture with your wife. Next get someone to take the same picture with you and your wife. Walk to one end of the

The view from the Old Town Bridge truly lives up to its postcard-worthy reputation. I had to come back to this bridge a few times throughout my stay in Trondheim. The river reflects beautifully on all the colorful houses erected on both sides of the river, as does the blue sky
I would not make a special trip just to see the bridge, however, it provides a wonderful view of the wharf area along the river. Plus it is the best access to 'Old Town'.
We walked across this several times during our stay. Some lovely views across to the cathedral. Connects to Baklandet.

Old town is a very beautiful place, and old town's bridge is a very nice place to visit especially when you have a chance to make a wish which will come true when you will pass by the gates of a bridge.
During my stay in Trondheim one must walk on & past this great attaction. Very close to the city center.

7-10 min walk from the downtown area and Trondheim central station. We can see the gorgeous design of the bridge, can estimate the culture from 1681. For me, it was rated average, the name of the bridge called by local is "The portal of the joy". It make me attraction.
It is the gate way to the old town so worth a look but not much more than that. We just walked across taking in the town
One of those places you have to go to, cos it's on the list. Nice river views as well as a big red bridge with chains. Easy to get to .

The Old Town Bridge in Trondheim is a must visit place, just 2min walk down from Nidarosdommen. The bridge gives you a nice sight of how the infrastructure worked in the old days, and it is also very nice to look at.
really nice place to see Bakklandet houses over the river :) Especially on sunny day :) Main tourist route. There are few nice coffe places :)
It's amazing to see the moon reflecting off the clear water. The lights in the buildings across are also quite stunning. The photos I have posted don't do the view enough justice

The best place from where i see the best views of my life, especially in the morning during the sunrise.

I walk across the bridge regularly, and never get tired of the view. North is the view of the old docks, south is the view of the old university building, and west is a glimpse of the Nidaros Cathedral. The bridge itself is 150 years old and also worth a visit in its own.

Enjoy the view of the city from the old town bridge, stop in the middle and contemplate the cityscape with Nidelva river. So beautiful and romantic. Most typical photos of Trondheim are taken here. ;)
From this old historic bridge you have a great view of Nidelven. From town centre you can cross this bridge to Bakklandet.
Visited on our walk back from the cathedral on a cool February day. Nice to see an Old piece of Architecture preserved so nicely.
It's worth a visit if you explore the Old Town. Beautiful view across the river on both sides. Nice to take pictures with.
You can take pictures of Bakklandet, but also during the sunset, you can take photos of Gloshaughen campus, which might appear like Hogwart.

This is considered the most romantic bridge in Trondheim, or possibly in the whole of Norway. Standing on the bridge you have a wonderful view along the Nidelva (the river), some of the most beautiful views of Trondheim.
Worth a visit if exploring the city on a walking / cycling tour. Looks equally pretty at nighttime too.
We arrived with Hurtigruten and we did the walking tour on our own. Easy stroll and with several mirador points, despite the cold weather!
It used to be nicer back in the old days. When you had the wooden portals on both entrances. But it is stil pretty awesome. Be sure to check it out if you are downtown.
Go see the Old Town Bridge and enjoy the view of the river. Upwards you'll see the main building of the University, NTNU, and downwards you'll see the old wharves on both sides of the river.
The location of the bridge allowed good views up and down the river . It was clearly a popular spot as we were not the only visitors there.

Take a walk over "Trondheim Bybro" to "Bakklandet", its a quite old historic part of town, with quaint littel restaurants and bars. On the bridge you have a fantastic view of the river and the old boathouses along the river edge
This is the cosyest place in Trondheim. Nice cafes, a few small designers shops and that uphill "Trampe". Great view.

The view here would be nice at different times of the year and different times of the day. Trondheim is relatively small so I suggest you come back at least on different days/times to fully experience the view.

Every visitor in Trondheim has to see this old bridge. There has been a bridge at this site since 1681. In the beginning as a part of the fortification of kristiansten fortress. Todays bridge was built in 1861. The bridge is also known as "Lykkens Portal" (gate of happines),

Havibg lived in trondheim for 28 years I think I am well versed in the sights. I have been working away for a while and coming home I stoof on Gamle Bybro and looked roward Bakkebru. It was a snowy day and the river was flat calm. What a beautiful thing to behold.

Trondheim is a very walkable city. Unless there is an attraction outside of town you want to see, just walk the city. You will want to make it to the Old Town Bridge, at least for the views. Make sure you have your camera! If you get a city map, and plan your route, you will be
Easily accessible and right in the center of town. Make sure you cross this bridge for the iconic scenes of the coloured houses along the riverside :)
Well preserved old bridge, can be icy in winter. Spans the older parts of the town with the more modern.

If you like to take a walk when visiting a new town, you should certainly make sure that you plan your route to include this bridge. It brings you into Bakklandet, which also is a nice area to walk around, and you get some nice views from the bridge - bring your camera for

You know what it's like when you visit a new city for the 1st time, you rarely have a clue where to visit. Well if you are in Trondheim then the Old Town bridge is a good place to start. I mean don't get me wrong, it's just a pedestrian bridge, but it's located in a

Links the main old part of Trondheim 200 meters from the Cathedral to the trendy Bakklandet district famous for its boutique restaurants. The bridge is photogenic and in excellent condition. It is traffic free apart from bicycles.
Make sure you visit the Bridge in both the day and at night as well. At night it has a lovely mood and good photo opportunities.

The bridge is nice and sweet but if I had not known that it is afamous sight, I would not have noticed it. The most spectacular thing might be the view on the harbour houses as well as the cathedral. If you are at the bridge, make sure to check out the elevator for bycicles at
The view is quite nice, but the bridge itself isn't really striking. Not worth devouring too but I'd you make a square tour of the city this bridge is worth stopping to admire the view from.
This bridge has a nice view of old town on the water. We crossed it several times and it seems to be a regular pathway by the locals
very interesting style and great view both up and down stream from the bridge. you can cross over the Nidelva river to go into the old town or hike to Kristiansten Fortress

Well, I guess the title says it all. Its an old brigde. Nothing spectacular, but of course it has a nice view. Even though I wasn't amazed, it is a landmark in Trondheim and a mandatory visit if its your first time here.
Take a walk with your loved one - you will not regret. The bridge is so beautiful and reminds us of the old times.
Nice place but nothing interesting. It was raining, so we couldnt even take good pictures. 5 minutes more then ebough to spend there

The old bridge is so well preserved it is amazing. Worth the visit several times over be it for the vistas, the music or just enjoying the water. My preference is late in the day with the sun low on the horizon. The colours along the river are spectacular.
The cafes and cobblestone streets leading upto the bridge are just beautiful. The bridge is a nice place to get epic pictures of the colorful constructions of the backwaters

Beautiful view on both sides of the bridge and a good place to take photos. On the other side of the bridge you will find Bakklandet where you can find many nice cafes or just go for a walk and admire the small wooden houses.

Is not like the best thing ever but the view form the bridge to the houses that are close to the water is pretty neat

We mooched across this bridge and spent quite a lot of time drinking in the atmosphere of the river and the amazing wooden buildings along the river bank. Crossing the bridge gives you access to the picturesque old town which is well worth walking around. You also might find the

Once in Trondheim you will pass from the Old Towns Bridge on the way from Nidarusdomen to Bakklandet (the old Trondheims town). Rest for a while here. It has an iteresting architectur. A nice vieu over the river "Nidelva" to Trondheims University, the old Bakklandet town and all
Enjoy the brightly painted buildings lining the opposite shore and take a photo of them as well as their reflection in the water.
The locals refer to The Old Town Bridge as the "Bridge of Happiness" and claim that your dreams will come true if you wish for them fervently as you walk across it. Lets hope so.

The Bridge itself is not that impressive but the views of the colorful buildings from the bridge make them worth a visit. They are a two minute walk from the Cathedral so it is not out of your way to go and visit The Old Town Bridge.
Tis old bridge is a landmark of trondheim. Close to the cathedral, and when you cross it, you enter bakklandet with all the old wooden houses, cafes and the pedestrian street
Lovely view up and down the river. Closed to motorized vehicles, but watch out for the bicyclists :)
As a resident of Trondheim, I usually don't notice to view spots around town. But this one is a classic. Take a rest on the way to Baklandet and post a picture on Instagram :)
The places around are beautiful. Take a chance to walk in near locations and see traditional buildings.

This is the historic walking bridge over the river in the old part of town. It seems everyone who comes to visit comes here to take photos of both the bridge and the historic buildings along the river. It does have a lovely feel and nice views but it can be very crowded.
The Old Town Bridge is a great spot to take photos of some of the famous buildings of Trondheim (in addition to taking photos of the bridge itself).
Nice exit/enter to a nice part of the city. Old and beautiful bridge. Best of all its safe to walk on;)

The 82 metre long, over 300 year old Town Bridge connects the two banks of the River Nidelven from the Southern end of Kjøpmannsgata and connects the city centre with Bakklandet, which is an area with great cafes and unique boutiques. It is also near the starting point of The
such lovely bridge with great view over river and both sides of old, charming houses...something nice and gentle about this spot for sure and so close to Cathedral and nice walk around river ....
The work on the restoration took ages but now finished its lovely. A great Sunday morning walk with beautiful views of the river, historic architecture and relaxing atmosphere.

We walked across the Old Town Bridge after visiting the Fortress higher up. You get a good view of the old warehouse buildings on wooden stilts along the river and makes for a great spot for a photo in Trondheim. Reminds me a bit of Ketchikan in Alaska.
This bridge is the centre of the old town and gives lovely views of the old warehouses from the river side.

When visiting Trondheim, the Old Town Bridge, Gamle Bybro, built in 1681, is something you must see. It's not only picturesque in its own right, but it affords a beautiful view up and down the river as you cross to Baklendet - the old city. The colorful houses along the river
The bridge has a nice view and an interesting history. My wife and I took the bridge to walk up to Kristiansten Fortress.
Nice view on the old wooden warehouses along the river Nid, another main sight of Trondheim. The bridge is free of traffic
This is a very nice area for stroll. Cross the bridge and enjoy the cobblestone road on the other side with its colorful buildings and such. Lots of places to sit out and grab a bite and soak it up!
It is nice, old fashioned, historical bridge in centre of historical town so worth to see it in this town :)
When in the area its a nice walk from Nidarosdomen to the old treehouses, to get there you have to walk the Old Town Bridge.
The old bridge is well maintained. And great views from it. Not cars on it. Connects the Old city to the side where the old houses are and lots of cafes and places to ebjoy.
By the old town and worth stopping to photograph the view. We passed it a few times in differing weather.
Bring your camera! Shots from the bridge cannot be beat. Great coffee houses on the "left bank" of Trondheim when you cross the bridge.
A lovely walk down to the old town. The bridge is lovely to look at and have your photo taken next to.
The bridge is a very pretty and unique bridge and the view from it of the waterway and buuildings around it are very fun to see.

The old bridge and views are worth visiting if headed in the area Its a quaint area. On the other side is a sort of artsy district with nice bars and cafes perfect for the perfect weather on the day we were in town
We walked passed a few times when we were wandering around the city, different weather, different scene, very beautiful, not to be miss!
Quick stop, beautiful bridge, between the Nidarosedome and the bicycle elevator - you'll cover it within a minute

The old town bridge as it now stands was built in 1861, but is orginally from 1681. Photos of this bridge and the view from it ,is taken by thousands every year. It’s really picturesque and well worth seeing when you are in Trondheim so don’t miss it.

We went for a walk on a beautiful sunny day to the Old Town Bridge. Just breathtaking on both sides of the bridge. Look at the photos and you will know why. If you are visiting Trondheim, really have to go to the Old Town Bridge.
Walking around city we decided to check out old town bridge, very charming spot. Nice view and good location to take some romantic pictures.
Certainly worth going to for a photo stop. The bridge crosses the Nidelva River. Good place to take photos of some of the older buildings along the river. Note that many are not all that vertical.
The bridge and the area is a light happy side of town. All houses are brightly colored, and walking on the bridge is a wonderful experience. We have also met a lot of tourists, all in happy moods.
The Old Town Bridge is just that, an old bridge. Picturesque, leading from the Mid Town to Bakklandet, an area with small cafees and other water holes.

This bridge which was once a lifting bridge spans part of the river which was once part of the merchant shipping quarter. It gives you an insight into the early days when the river was used by sailing ships which required the bridge to lift.

The waterway with its buildings right on the water edge makes a great photo and from this bridge you get a great vantage point. It connects the church side with the old town side. Altogether you can get create a pleasant looped walk around Trondheim.

The old town bridge is not that startling, but is easy to get to when exploring the sights in Trondheim. Its near the Church and the bike lift, both attractions worthy of visiting. There are many picture opportunities from the bridge
Nice spot, if you are putting the history in the side for a second it's just a bridge, not even that beautiful
Old town bridge is amazing itself, you can go by cycling or by foot and enjoy the fantastic view of viking era. Old town bridge is near to st. Olav church.

Take a stroll into Old Town, crossing a picturesque bridge. Stop to admire the rushing water, the boats, and the historic buildings on stilts. It is impossible to continue without taking THE photo of Trondheim's most scenic attraction.
Lovely old bridge will take you across the river from inner city to cafe strip. Find a local guide to tell you all about the old houses & wharf scene that used to be Trondheim.
You are so close to the nature yet in the center of the town, and this piece of work is stunning and you want to go back and forth that bridge all day
If you're in Trondheim for a day, you're bound to cross this bridge. It's not really a "thing to do" or a destination-But nice spot to take a picture.
This bridge links the town cathedral area with the old city. It gives a very good view of the old buildings by the river.

Great to go for a walk over the old town bridge in Trondheim. Not only is the bridge itself of historical importance, but you also get a great view of all the beautiful sea houses alongside the river. On one side of the bridge it she peaceful beautiful city park, which includes
Must see for photo location when walking the old dockyard area. All signs are in Norwegian but the bridge used to have a section that lifted up.

Took a walk from the Cathedral through the park on the bridge, the scenery is awesome, a lot of interesting architecture and building mixing with the canals, and then walked up till the university campus, which is a massive building definitely worth the walk
The Old bridge is kept clean and well maintained. Nothing to be amazed at. The bridge provides a nice view of the river.
Best thing to do in Trondheim - which is not saying much actually but really it is beautiful - I think better than Bergen
Nice old bridge with a really cute view on the old coloured wooden houses on both sides of the river.
A short but easy walk from the city centre. Great photos off the bridge of the beautiful old wharf sheds. Lovely place
The bridge over the Nidelva is just ok, but the view on the wooden storehouses of the Wharves is just spectacular. Part of a walk around the first capital of Norway.
Nothing special architecturally, but some decent views. If you go to Trondheim, you're going to cross it. The bridge itself just isn't very memorable.
Cross over this old, beautiful bridge to come on the northern side of the river to visit Bakklandet where you will find many nice cafes on your way to Kristiansten fortress. It's a great stroll!
the look from this bridge gives the perspective of the wooden houses on the canal. very impressive with all its colores and the garden on the other side of the bridge.

This bridge is just so cute! A visit takes you 10 min, and is easily combined with a visit to the Cathedral. I would also recomend to have lunch at Bakklandet and not to forget: have a look at the Trampe CycloCable, situated only 200m from the bridge.
Cross here, turn left, and enjoy the cafes, restaurants, etc., and the great views of the old warehouses.
We saw the beautiful buildings along the river that you see in all the brochures...for real. It's close to the church that is worth going through. Magical.

This is the old town bridge crossing the river Nidelven . Its portal is named "The portal of happiness". From the bridge you have a stunning view of the old wooden warehouses along the riverside and of parts of the Nidaros Cathedral.
Very scenic and pretty place. Good angles for photos. The colourful buildings beside the river makes the scene more attractive.

If you're into the bridges, then you should go and check it out. For not enthusiastic bridge people, the bridge itself it's ok, but I think the main attraction would be the view from it, onto the famous, colorful buildings. Also when you pass the bridge towards the cruise ship
Trondheim an easy place to wander about just over this bridge is a bike lift and the views over the river are a must. The wooden houses on either site is a great view
Lovely old bridge with great views down the river. Very busy so hard to get a photo, but views down stream were lovely with the old buildings.
Gives a wonderful view of the old colorful warehouse buildings along the river near shops and cafes along the riverfront.
We passed by this bridge a few times while roaming around the city. It was beautiful plus a good spot to take photographs of the old fishing wharves.

The old bridge gates are beautiful and the bridge itself has some interesting views of the old town wooden buildings by the river. Well worth seeing but more of a site to taek in "en route" rather than spending a lot of time there.
A nice bridge, but honestly not a real sight. There si a nice view there, but there is also from other bridges.

The Old Town Bridge was interesting but really it was the views of the Bryggen (old warehouses) which are part of the Bakklandet area that are the main reason to visit the bridge. A good way to see interesting parts of Trondheim is to start at the Niadros Cathedral, then walk
The old town bridge is very beautiful. it takes you back in time. the view from the bridge is fantastic and the walk through the old town is very beautiful.
Great photospot for taking pictures of the old houses along the river. Remember to take a look at the bicycle elevator and watch people fall :)
i thought it was going to be special because it's quite famous there. but by looking at all the photos, it;s just a bridge. you can take a picture with the beautifully painted houses though.
Right after the bridge there are many beautiful cafes in a quite area without many cars. Ideal for walking. You can also see the wooden houses
We were wandering around this place between 8-9am like lots of other tourists and there was very little to see or do. So best to go there later in the day I think.

Gamle Bybro is the old bridge over the river Nidelva, connecting the city center with Bakklandet. You have a great view over the old store houses north of it and the main building of the university to the south.
This is a must see when in Trondheim. Buildings are beautifully painted and worth of a selfie. One of the few landmarks in Trondheim.
I am sure this is a model of a bridge that was there yonks ago but a bridge it is not, just a construction sitting on a bridge. Worth a visit but that's all.
The bridge is nice to have a look at, and it will bring you to the old center, but besides that nothing more. I thought it would be better...

This little bridge is one of the most iconic places in Trondheim. I personally love to cross it when I'm walking through the city. The view it's amazing during the night and gorgeous at dusk. You must go there once
